intro: Floscopa africana, commonly known as African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces a bulbous root system that stores nutrients, allowing it to survive dry periods. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that emerge from the base of the plant. Floscopa africana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soil and full sun.
